style.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a particular way of doing, designing, or producing something, especially one that is typical of a particular place, period of time, or group of people
style.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: an attempt to use Japanese management style in a European business
The dinner will be served buffet-style.
style.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: the particular way that someone behaves, works, or deals with other people
style.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Children have different styles of learning: some learn by seeing, some by hearing, some by doing.
I like your style (=approve of the way you do things), Simpson.
I can’t ask a man out – it’s not my style (=it is not the way I usually behave).
I don’t think the parachuting weekend is for me – the art class is more my style.
style.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a typical way of writing, painting etc that is used by a particular person or during a particular period of time
style.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The paintings are in an expressionistic style.
a play in the style of classical Greek tragedy
style.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: a particular design or fashion for something such as clothes, hair, furniture etc
style.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Car styles have changed radically in the past 20 years.
The rooms are furnished in a modern style.
style.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: young women interested in style rather than comfort
Long skirts are back in style.
style.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: a confident and attractive quality that makes people admire you, and that is shown in your appearance, or the way you do things
style.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: You may not like her, but she certainly has style.
style.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: a way of using words or spelling that is considered correct
style.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: It’s not good style to use abbreviations in an essay.
style.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to design clothing, furniture, or the shape of someone’s hair in a particular way
style.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: These shoes have been styled for maximum comfort.
She has her hair styled by Giorgio.
style.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a way of doing something, designing something, or producing something, especially one that is typical of a particular time, place, or group of people
style.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: the Japanese style of stock investment
style.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: the particular way that someone does something or deals with other people
style.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: His tough management style has upset some executives.
style.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: a product with a particular design, shape, and appearance
style.translation[2].definitions[2].exam: Each diaper comes in ‘girl’ and ‘boy’ styles.
This is one of our new styles, a $135 dress shoe with a rubber sole.
style.translation[2].definitions[3].defi: the official name or title of a company
style.translation[2].definitions[3].exam: The company traded under the style of Macron Ltd.
